column5: Headed to the upper niagara river again this mornin, fishing seems slower this week i suspect the fish are heading to erie or at least starting to, got 10 or so smallmouth ,nothing big, but they are sure fat, lost a life jacket somewheres ,but he worst was my drop shot rod, got snagged up on something, usually the dropshot weights just pull off ,not this time, starts spoolin me so i grab the line with my index and middle finger, usually the weight pulls off, burn my 2 fingers so i let off and woop there goes the rod and reel, man what a aweful feeling, had to laugh what else could you do LOL, just not how i wanted to upgrade, so here are some pics , hope you all had a better day than me!!
Bud  Your face in pic's #1 and #2 tell the whole story.  Sorry about your gear, but good that you can still laugh about it.  Cheers  Craig
Oh man, that's gotta bite.  Burn your fingers AND lose your gear - ouch!!!  Sorry to hear that man.  Nice smallies otherwise.  Joey
That current is relentless, try jigging with a 6 oz. swimbait, 80 pound braid on a Muskie rod and get a snag...
Is that first pic the last picture ever taken of that rod??  :o If so, I'd be pretty upset too.
Sorry to hear about the gear lost   .... but those are some fine bass you caught there  Thanks for sharing Leechman
LoL ya ... someones going to get a great surprise snagging that set up from the bottom, new model this year stradic and crucial drop shot rod... sighhhhhh!
sorry bout the gear...dunno how many rods i have busted this year...realy sucks....but some good fish as compensation i guess.
o man. I did the same thing last year .... could only watch it sink deeper and deeper down and do nothing about it...  nice fish though!
Some nice smallies. Sucks about your rod though. We've all been there in one way or another.
